page.title: 16The Little City
page.content:
Yesterday, July 4th, we walked to City Road. When we got there we looked around. Most of the houses had big bolts through the wall to hold the house together because there was an old mine underneath. Some houses didn't have bolts because they weren't affected by it. Most of the land around is waste land.
We saw the Methodist Church. It was built in 1868. We also saw some houses which had dates when they were built. Some houses were built in 1902, 1894 and 1876. We saw some homing pigeons. The city is little and there is more fieldland than housing.
2 accounts written by Junior 1 children following a visit to the area behind the former Mosley Common pit. The city has 3 terraces and 1 chapel.
